abstract.para: The chapter provides a description of available raw images of &slem;.

sect1.title: Delivered raw images
sect1.para: &slema; is delivered for the followin architectures

listitem.para: An image installable on all x86_64 machines.
An image with a real-time kernel.
An image intended to use with FBA storage devices.
An image intended to use with DASD storage devices
An image where &slema; is used as a KVM host.
An image installable on the ARM machines.

sect1.title: Default partitioning
sect1.para: The raw images ale delivered with a default partitioning scheme, which can be changed during the first boot by using Ignition or Combustion. For a procedure of repartitiong the system, refer to or .

important.title: Btrfs is mandatory for the root file system.
important.para: Bear in mind that if you intend to perform any changes to the default partitioning scheme, that the root file system must be btrfs.

The images also have mounted subvolumes for booting by default. The concrete subvolumes differ according to the architecture.

sect1.title: First boot detection
sect1.para: The configuration runs on the first boot only and to distinquish between the first and subsequent boots, the /boot/ignition.firstboot is used. If the file is detected, the attribute ignition.firstboot is passed to the kernel command line, which triggeres creating initramfs with Ignition or running the dracut module in case of Combustion. After completing the configuration on the first boot, the /boot/ignition.firstboot is deleted.
